alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 2:24PM CST until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... San Jacinto River near Sheldon affecting Harris County. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sheldon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Jacinto River near Sheldon. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with widespread inundation of the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening and continue rising to a crest of 12.8 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 11/18/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun San Jacinto River Sheldon 10.0 8.5 Thu 1 pm CST 11.2 12.5 12.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 830 AM CST.
